website_summaries.verdict: The stunning Etymotic ER4 XR earphones deliver the sonic accuracy sound professionals need, and add some subtle depth in the lows to complement modern mixes.
pros: Exceptionally accurate mids and highs coupled with rich, full bass response
Plethora of eartip options in various sizes and styles
Ships with several accessories, including zip-up case
cons: No inline remote control or mic

website_summaries.verdict: The Etymotic ER4 SR headphones provide an accurate, unrivaled critical listening experience.
pros: Exceptional audio performance with supreme clarity and accuracy
Nice array of accessories, including headphone jack adapter, replacement filters, and carrying case
cons: Not for those seeking bass-forward sound signature

customer_reviews.title: These are the best of the best
customer_reviews.text: So, these In Ear Montiors are every bit as good as the best reviews people have posted. I guess it comes down to the question of whether they're worth the ridiculous asking price. That's totally subjective; have you really heard the wonderful guitar solo at the end of Wuthering Heights? Sparks's Number One Song in Heaven is a huge laugh. A few songs reveal no more detail over good headphones - Debaser, Springsteen's The River until the title track. That said, theese IEMs generally let you appreciate the effort of the artist and mixer involved, be it bass, drums, vocals or synthesiser. Do I have regrets about buying these? Yes. I wish I'd bought them sooner. They are ridiculously good.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Great sound 10/10
customer_reviews.text: I owned a previous generation version of these and they were very very good, these are everything i was expecting, absolutely delighted with the sound right out of the box but as with all decent audio equipment once burned in they should be even better.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: One of the best iems under £500 but check fit
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is awesome for the money, the only iem that comes close up to £500 is the grado gr10e. Proper reference sound. Only downside is the fit which requires the earphone to be inserted far deeper than any other iem I’ve used. This may bother some users.
customer_reviews.author: teknorob23

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Crystal-clear audio and fantastic soundstage once you get over the initial discomfort of using them, as described by girlfriend as 'bugs in your ear' but golly, the bugs are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: shanesully

customer_reviews.title: Hands down
customer_reviews.text: I'm rediscovering my music. Can't compare them to any other 300 quid pair, but the new experience of sound detail makes me think I've just found a milestone for a good while. Knowing these are considerably a flat response pair of monitors I'm not going to look any further for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: aardvark

customer_reviews.title: Ģood, Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Good isolation. Clear, detailed sound. Better with players with strong amplification or extant amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: ab

customer_reviews.title: BUY THEM
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned Etymotics for 14 years, and these sound the best. Crystal clear across the spectrum, even on noisy train rides through London’s underworld. Only one minor gripe: they tangle easily, so store them away carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pairs
customer_reviews.text: Needed it , bought it , Performed as expected Accurate , reflective , Large in density , natural sound effect Phenomenal Crystal clear Pricy but worth the quality , Above,
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: The king for £300
customer_reviews.text: To keep it short, I've never had a IEM like this that sounds so fantastic while being very neutral. But if want more low end the XR versions are a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Sakkai soi

customer_reviews.title: The one by which all should be judged.
customer_reviews.text: No fuss, no hype, no pretence; just thoroughly accurate and thoroughly professional. That's what I needed and that's what I got. A huge aesthetic upgrade over the original. Replaceable cables. I'm very happy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Carel F. Cronje

customer_reviews.title: Studio-quality in-ear headphones
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. Good, flat response over full audio range. Using customised flanges, near-complete noise reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. W. Nyman

customer_reviews.title: Returned and replaced with Shure 535's I am nor sure ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned and replaced with Shure 535's I am nor sure why these are so highly rated but it could be that my hearing is not refined enough :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very mediocre at the very best!
customer_reviews.text: I can't understand how people can think this sounds good as to me it is very mediocre at the very best, combine this with the very uncomfortable invading ear tips - combined with a hefty price tag, I can only give this a very generous 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Light-Man

customer_reviews.title: Music filter removed! :)
customer_reviews.text: Ok put these on and I can hear everything in my mix. It's like someone took the filter off my music. These are not flattering they are very flat and not enhanced in any way. Exactly what I wanted. I usually use AKG 240 open back headphones for a basic mix before I go to external monitors for final mix. Not any more these show you exactly what your mix sounds like without enhancements. After doing a quick mix with these I tested the mix with my AKS's and a set of Bose and the mix sounded great. Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than the stupid Bose headphones in nearly every way!
customer_reviews.text: Way better for travel than the over-rated Bose NR headphones: 1) These fit in you pocket, the Bose do not. 2) These block all sound (including crying kids), the Bose only does constant sounds very well. 3) These sound as good or better than the Bose 4) These do not give you the stuffy head sensation that NR headphones do. HIGHLY recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Astroman

customer_reviews.title: Cleanest IEM and Headphone I have ever heard so far. Wow.
customer_reviews.text: Sound better and clearer than my reference AKGK702 cans, and those are the best sounding headphones I have listened to thus far. The AKG's sound warmer but these sound cleaner and detailed which is hard to do with a reference grade can like the K702. Great Product, I want to try the ER4XR and get a custom mold for my ear and see how that works. The bass is thin but detailed. Maybe those XR's will be better down low.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Etymotic are consistently excellent
customer_reviews.text: You like flat accuracy? Then they’re amazing. I look forward to the bluetooth component to replace their analog connection. But still great even without it. Shirt clip was weak and didn’t stay attached to the appropriate bit on the wires long. But otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: ESL

customer_reviews.title: These are way more comfortable than big heavy headphones
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent. I hate wearing big heavy headphones for long periods of time when recording music. I can wear these all day without any problems. You do have to push them rather deep into your ear canals to get the best sound, but the sound is very full and all the frequencies are there. Makes for a more enjoyable recording/mixing section. I have not used my headphones since I got these. It's a bit expensive but is worth it in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Timer

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive not to be reliable, sorry!
customer_reviews.text: The Etymotic Research in-Ear Monitors Headphone Black (846430002012) worked superbly until Sunday, 3 February, 2019. They became intermittent with their sound and cannot be used again. I tried them in various music producing items and sound monitors, still the same results. I wanted to ask for a new pair in exchange, but I'm passed the date to return & ask of for a new pair in exchange. Thank you and I'm truly sorry for bad review as the were a great sounding ear monitor for my uses. Regards, Bob Mattingly
customer_reviews.author: Robert P Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch with the accessories
customer_reviews.text: There has been plenty of reviews on sound quality over the decades for the ER4 series. No complaint from me either. However, the small pouch I got smells horrible, like industrial chemicals. The big pouch has some defects inside but I am not going to use it much anyway. Get some Comply P-series foam tips and your ears will be happier.
customer_reviews.author: A MAN

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the best headphones I have heard. The are so accurate. Some people may not like how accurate and flat they are, but I love them. The only problem I've had is that the cable may have connectivity issues after some time. Although that may have been my fault as sometimes I accidentally pull on them. You can buy replacements so it's not that big of a deal. They do tire me out after extremely long periods of listening but it's worth it. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noise isolation is better than cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Jam up sound from Hendrix to Sogovia. I can work comfortably for hours with diesel engines rattling away and NOT blast my eardrums out to cover up and escape the noise. Only when I use machine tools like lathes & saws do I go back to bluetooth noise canceling headsets for safety reasons of stray wires getting caught in something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I use these for mixing and mastering on the plane or at home when traffic or the neighbors get too noisy. They are outstanding and sound like nothing else. Comfort isn’t really an issue for me since I’m used to in-ear monitors. I didn’t find these to be as uncomfortable as people say - can wear them for an hour or two before fatigue sets in. It’s a good incentive to take a break and rest your ears every half hour - hour which is something most engineers already do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My third pair now.
customer_reviews.text: Well , i have lost two pairs of ER4SR over 4 years dued to my own fault,this is my third pair.still i found that soundwise ER4SR still the best comparing to hifi in-ear of this range, and in fact you shouldn’t use term hifi for er4sr, because its value is in non-coloring sound, neutral and flat. I use it when i have to do audio recording or listening to music which have lots of acoustic instrument like jazz , classical or folk music. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vekit

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like the originating studio wanted their music to sound.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding clarity. Deep, not scattered or muddy bass. A tad expensive but fully compares with phones going for three times as much.
customer_reviews.author: William Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: Initial fit is a little bit uncomfortable. Once you get used to it, there's no issue with comfort. The SR's are a little low on the bass, takes some getting used to. I would probably get the XR's if I had to buy it again since I listen to mostly electronic music, but overall I've been really happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: rochan

customer_reviews.title: Great  natural sounding reference IEM
customer_reviews.text: great sounding earphone, flat and natural sound, silicon tip is painful to insert, but have greater detail once sitting properly. Had a ER4XR amaze by it and now get a ER4SR. the detail is fantastic. great sound isolation, not as good outside noise suppression compare to active noise cancelling headphone (bose qc 35 II or sony 1000xm2), but still very usable during flight. foam tip is more comfortable, but sacrifice on the detail.
customer_reviews.author: eeys

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: I read many of the reviews about these being superb but I found them anything but. I played them many times and switched the equalizer over and over but the high were always shrill and the lack of bass was disheartening. I get the feeling the positive reviews are not true.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica T.

customer_reviews.title: they sound great. very detailed and clear
customer_reviews.text: just got these 06/13/2018. they sound great. very detailed and clear. some people say there's not enough bass, they must be bassheads. I find the bass on these to be fine. they're not bass heavy, so If you want lots of or extra bass, you may not want these.
customer_reviews.author: robert edwards

customer_reviews.title: Pure sound...too pure!
customer_reviews.text: This is for discerning listeners. It's sound as real as it was recorded. If you like the thump and the hiss, these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: jrzap

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality but a little painful to wear
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is absolutely great! It doesn't have much of over express on bass, just plain accurate sound. One thing is that the stethoscope effect is pretty strong, you need some technique to put the cord over your ear in order to get rid of it.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Really nice in ear headphone
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, like all Etymotic products. One of the best in ear monitors in this price range. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Johnson

customer_reviews.title: very uncomfortable while first try
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound _ very accurate I love the fit_ but only while u try more than 2 weeks I love the cable_ but quite too long (6 ft) Overall _ amazing earbuds but need to fit for a while
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’ve had several sets of Etymotic ears and they’ve aways ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several sets of Etymotic ears and they’ve aways been of the highest quality.
customer_reviews.author: james hyde

customer_reviews.title: Buy them
customer_reviews.text: I am hard of hearing and as such I need the best hearing device and I can start to listen to my CDs again. The purest high notes and base notes.
customer_reviews.author: Edward H Baldridge

customer_reviews.title: Christmas disappointment...
customer_reviews.text: Right speaker blew completely out after 20 minutes of use. Merry freakin Christmas to me. I would say be wary of third-party sellers it looked like the Box may have been tampered with. Super disappointed decided to go with the Klipsch x20i instead getting them Wednesday... too bad too because for 20 minutes they sounded terrific...
customer_reviews.author: Ellricngin

customer_reviews.title: Neutral, Flat, Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I sought these out looking for relatively flat/neutral earbuds that could suppress as much external sound as possible during events. After reading head-fi review I was sold - and now that I've received them and paired with my o2 headphone amp - I can confirm that, for me at least, these knock it out of the park. Listening to high quality audio mixes I can easily isolate instruments and voices and hear their exact detail with no discernible compromise to clarity. If you're listening for enjoyment and prefer something with a lot of bottom - maybe look at the XR
customer_reviews.author: MrCincinnati

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT FAILS AFTER 2 YEARS!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the sound quality of these earphones, but can't afford to keep replacing when they fail. This our families 4th pair! (my son received a pair which failed, then replaced which also failed, I am now on my second pair and they have fortunately failed inside the two year warranty window so at least etymotic has to replace this pair for free). Same issue, over time one or both of the speaker drivers become distorted, slowly reduce output, and then blow. Very frustrating as the sound quality is outstanding. Four pairs that have failed over multiple years, however, do not lie.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Morrell

customer_reviews.title: Very weak bass
customer_reviews.text: For me headsets are a hit or miss. These ones have a very (and I do mean VERY) weak bass. The highs dominate the entire acoustic experience...
customer_reviews.author: Alexandru Stamate

customer_reviews.title: ER-4SR is insanely detailed
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine through a different vendor and I'm blown away at the detail and realistic reproduction of sound. Lyrics are crystal clear. The audible spectrum is entirely present without any peaks or enhancements. I've never heard any headphone sound so convincingly like a live performance. Being used to other headphones it does feel a little light in bass BUT if I'm honest with myself these are the more honest, most faithful headphones I now own. Now if I could just find over ear headphones that sound this good!
customer_reviews.author: AZFalconer

customer_reviews.title: Holy smoke Batman!
customer_reviews.text: Dang these things sound good. Crisp! Great clarity, tight sound stage. Listening feels very personal. The isolation is great as well. Ideally I wanted isolation without the loss of sound quality. I have Bose 25, 35s which isolate fine but the audio quality is not there. These solve this issue if you can deal with IEM's. The sponge tips work great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Doe

customer_reviews.title: Review on the XR
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are a must, one if the best in ear headphones tuned to perfection, might take a day or two to get used to the tuning but these are a must for anyone's collection. Run on a balanced set up just adds the extra sparkle to a great iem !
customer_reviews.author: Roger Mellie

product_meta.title: Etymotic ER4-SR Studio Reference In-Ear Isolating Earphone with Replaceable Cable - Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:StudioEtymotic ER4-SR is the new reference standard hi-fidelity earphone for those who demand nothing less than the highest fidelity. This next generation ER4-SR delivers increased accuracy with greater sound output. Like its predecessor, the ER4-SR channels are matched within an industry-leading 1dB across frequencies from 100Hz to 10 kHz. ER4-SR incorporates significant cosmetic and functional improvements, from a sleek, anodized and laser-etched aluminum body to the reinforced, user-replaceable detachable cable. The ER4SR is a must have for discerning engineers, audiophiles and consumers wanting the most accurate in-ear earphone available. Etymotic invented noise-isolating, in-ear earphones. Etymotic's original insert earphone design, developed for auditory research and medical diagnostics used balanced armature receivers and established these speakers as the gold standard for high-definition, in-ear earphones. Decades of research and development.

BOX CONTAINS
Etymotic ER4-SR Studio Reference Earphones 6.35mm stereo adaptor Assortment of ACCU-Fit eartips Filter changing tool and replacement ACCU-Filter wax filters Channel-matching compliance graph Shirt clip Airline adaptor Travel pouch Storage box
feature_bullets: Enhanced accuracy with greater sound output and flat response
Braid-reinforced cable for enhanced durability and low microphonic effect
ACCU-Filter user-replaceable filters protect the balanced-armature drivers from ear wax
Industry-exclusive channel-matching compliance graph.Professional quality and reliability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars229 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
